discussion.content:
SSM - Many sources to Limited receivers
Many sources - Can use the same group
Limited receivers - Receivers require to define what source they are listening too.
Should be "limited sources" not limited receivers

questions.question_text:
Drag and Drop Questions -
When developing a multicast network design, SSM should be used for which type of source and receiver distribution?
//IMG//

A.
B.
C.
D.

Refer to the exhibit. Your junior design engineer presents this configuration design. What is the next-hop router for CE3, and why?
//IMG//

choices.D: CE1. HSRP on CE1 is in active state.
choices.C: CE2. The link between CE2 and PE1 has more bandwidth than CE1-to-PE1.
choices.B: CE2. EBGP administrative distance is lower than RIP.
choices.A: CE1. BGP weight is higher than CE2.

discussion.content: Well, PE1 peers with CE1 and CE2 via RIP and eBGP. Supposedly after that it peers with BGP VPNv4 (redistributing VRF routes from RIP and eBGP from CE1 and CE2) with RR is SP cloud or PE2, whatever. PE2 next hop to HSRP network is PE1. PE2 redistributes HSRP routes fro Site to RIP. Doesn't next-hop for those routes should be PE2 p2p link to CE2 itself ?

B- PE1 has both RIP and BGP routes. will prefer the routes of the protocol with better AD, BGP routes are preferred thus CE2
The question indeed is quite unclear, however analyzing the diagram
A- incorrect. weight is by default 0. Weight needs to be configured explicitly there is no weight config on the bgp configuration AND only one link has BGP, so only one route to the LAN. CE 1 not running BGP, Weight is a BGP metric.
C- BW is not taken into account on either RIP or BGP
D- Here is when it gets "wordy" if the question is CE3 to Site1_LAN or Site1_LAN to CE3. I believe the question is from CE to Site_LAN perspective. then this is also incorrect.
I guess D should be the right answer - unless I do not quite understand the question.

questions.question_text: A service provider creates a network design that runs MPLS in its WAN backbone using OSPF as the IGP routing protocol. What would be two effects of additionally implementing MPLS-TE? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: E is wrong in my opinion, MPLS-TE control-plane relied on RSVP and RSVP itself even it doesn't require IGP, but MPLS-TE does, since when you want to create LSP path for TE or declaring source address for TE (lo0) you need ISIS and OSPF for that.
AB correct ones. TE depends on IGP

choices.D: MPLS-TE cannot use OSPF for the traffic path calculation.
choices.A: MPLS-TE is required to reroute traffic within less than 1 second in case of a link failure inside the backbone.
choices.E: MPLS-TE is required to create backup paths independently from the IGP.
choices.B: MPLS-TE is required to route different MPLS QoS service classes through different paths.
choices.C: MPLS-TE and OSPF cannot be used together inside one MPLS network.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
fast hello packet? are you kidding me? 
IGP hello packet can be adjusted to seconds, but BFD can be adjusted to subsec, so BFD is the boss here for failure detection

I think the other correct answer is UDLD , this is for detecting failure path in unidirection either tx or rx in Physical level, not IP level like BFD

fast hello packet? are you kidding me? 
IGP hello packet can be adjusted to seconds, but BFD can be adjusted to subsec, so BFD is the boss here for failure detection

I think the other correct answer is UDLD , this is for detecting failure path in unidirection either tx or rx in Physical level, not IP level like BFD

questions.question_text: Which two mechanisms ensure that a network design provides fast path failure detection? (Choose two.)

You are hired to design a solution that will improve network availability for users on a campus network with routed access. If the budget limits you to three components, which three components would you recommend in your design proposal? (Choose three.)

choices.D: standby route processors for SSO in the access routers
choices.A: redundant power supplies in the access routers
choices.E: replace copper links between devices with fiber links
choices.C: standby route processors for SSO in the distribution routers
choices.B: standby route processors for SSO in the core routers

discussion.content:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/Enterprise/Campus/routed-ex.html#wp998203
The recommended best practice for campus design uses point-to-point fiber connections for all links between switches.
